meanings.definition: A person who cheats or swindles others.
meanings.sent1: The sharpers tricked the unsuspecting old man out of his savings.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of sharpers looking to take advantage of naive tourists.
meanings.sent3: The sharpers tried to sell a fake treasure map to the gullible travelers.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the sharpers lurking in the shadows, ready to deceive you.
meanings.sent5: The sharpers' schemes were finally exposed, bringing justice to their victims.

meanings.sent1: The sharpers gathered at the card table, ready to play their game.
meanings.sent2: The group of sharpers were known for their elaborate cons and scams.
meanings.sent3: The sharpers decided to team up and pull off the ultimate heist.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sharpers, trust is a rare commodity.
meanings.sent5: The sharpers' den was filled with stolen goods and ill-gotten gains.
